ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned a lot about Czech grammar
I gained the skills to communicate in Czech and read articles and pieces of Czech text at a basic level.  I am looking forward to gaining more knowledge next semester.
I was able to begin learning basic vocabulary and grammar of the language Czech.
I learned the basics of the Czech language
I learned the introductory basics to the language of Czech, while also learning about the culture of the Czech people in this course.
Understanding and speaking complex Czech words and sentences
A new language
I developed a great understanding of czech
I learned a lot about the culture and the language.
During this course I learned elementary Czech. Along with this I learned skills of teamwork.
A better understanding of Czech Language and culture.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: We should do more grammar practice in class
Prof von Kunes is the biggest strength of this course.  She makes the process of learning Czech, a difficult language, unintimidating and approachable.
More clear instructions about the homework assignments
My strengths in this course included the memorization of the basics, such as numbers, letters, and months/dates in czech. My biggest weakness was conjugating verbs.
I think a heavier focus on vocabulary and a prerequisite to learning cases and conjugations could help students understand what is being said.
Having to start from scratch in a language I was completely unfamiliar with
I asked questions when I was confused. But I also struggled with understanding the grammar.

Mrs. Von Kunes is one of the strengths of the course. Her Czech background not only a great environment to learn but creates a culture in the classroom like no other. She is devoted to and invested in her students.
Very engaging insructor, great class overall.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes
Yes-- I would recommend this course to any student that is interested in the Czech language and culture.  It is an interesting and complex language but very satisfying to learn.
Yes, very interesting language with a great professor.
I would definitely recommend this course due to how interesting and involving the course was.
Yes because its a good learning environment and Im learning a lot.
If you are interested in learning a language that is different then most, Id suggest this class.

I would recommend this course to other students because it is a very different type of course that is both engaging and challenging. It presents an opportunity for students connect with a part of the world that most don't have the ability or resources to.
Yes if you are interested in learning about Czech culture.
